name: TheAtlantic
text: Once a COVID-19 vaccine is approved, federal and state governments still have to distribute it. And a whole new round of trouble could start, reports @sarahzhang: https://t.co/W9IuPWnrSf

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When you look at how many people vote in general elections, it's just not enough. There's no way that government can work properly if it can't accurately reflect who we are as a nation." The actor @ChrisEvans on the inspiration for @ASP: https://t.co/LYfiZbmYqK #TheAtlanticFest https://t.co/iw0hrTelrk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Two proposals are gaining momentum among commentators and progressive activists: expanding the number of justices and instituting term limits. These ideas almost always seem to smack of political revenge," Lawrence Goldstone writes: https://t.co/7yh6aIdzMx

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/xf4jj5UekE

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “The conservative Christian elites Trump surrounds himself with have always been more clear-eyed about his lack of religiosity than they’ve publicly let on.” https://t.co/e0bjKupcFh

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @beccarosen: Absolutely beautiful little set of essays by @AdamHSays on the children who desegregated America's schools, and the adults they are today https://t.co/oA6lDwAJBG

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: Former aides say they’ve heard Trump privately ridicule conservative religious leaders, dismiss faith groups with cartoonish stereotypes, and deride rites and doctrines held sacred by many in his base.

My story on what Trump really thinks about religion: https://t.co/T8UyQ5bprr

name: TheAtlantic
text: 1/6 The Supreme Court decided that segregation of public schools was unconstitutional—but it was thousands of children who actually desegregated America’s classrooms, writes @beccarosen. Here are five of their stories. Introducing #TheFirsts: https://t.co/neW0LiwCeD

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2/6 Hugh Price and his family fought for him to be one of the first Black students at an all-white high school in Washington, D.C. Once he was there, he “couldn’t wait for it to be over,” @adamhsays reports. https://t.co/XKdEcpPLcx

name: TheAtlantic
text: 3/6 Jo Ann Allen Boyce and 11 other students desegregated their high school in Clinton, Tennessee. Then the riots came, @adamhsays writes. https://t.co/uFv4tDT74A

name: TheAtlantic
text: 4/6 Sonnie Hereford IV desegregated Alabama’s public schools in 1963. He was only 6 years old. By @adamhsays: https://t.co/EKloAGmika

name: TheAtlantic
text: 5/6 Millicent Brown changed Charleston, then watched it stay the same, @adamhsays reports. https://t.co/bAbqSqc08t

name: TheAtlantic
text: 6/6 Frederick K. Brewington’s education came at the end of a bitter civil-rights battle that engulfed New York state, more than a decade after 'Brown v. Board of Education.' From @adamhsays: https://t.co/ohlxDahQwF

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Only if the Senate performs a genuine, thorough review of the president’s nominee for a lifetime appointment to the highest court in the land, though, is this key piece of our system of checks and balances meaningful," @NoahBookbinder writes: https://t.co/tArMqYKYpV

name: TheAtlantic
text: In private, President Trump has spoken with cynicism and contempt about people of faith—and former aides say he views the religious right as a special-interest group to be conned, @mckaycoppins reports. https://t.co/fXzK6m3pqs

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: The Supreme Court declared segregation in schools unconstitutional, but children desegregated America. Today, we published a series of profiles on those students: https://t.co/cn6ianQkVw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @JohnGHendy: Man this @AdamHSays story https://t.co/OQPolQsrX3 https://t.co/CdnpbbfjWP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: "She told me to be on my best behavior and not to walk on anybody’s lawn, because remember they don’t want you over there anyway." https://t.co/7M9xBtKFzz https://t.co/UYnLQ2RPsz

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: I obtained a recording of a private meeting Trump had with religious right leaders in 2016. It's pretty revealing (especially when considering that, per Pew, most rank-and-file white evangelicals believe Trump is a religious man).  https://t.co/T8UyQ5bprr https://t.co/neKwiYlgjP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: Trump has frequently made fun of Mitt Romney’s faith in private—and was especially vicious when he learned about the religious undergarments worn by many Mormons. “Oh my god,” Cohen said. “How many times did he bring up Mitt Romney and the undergarments" https://t.co/T8UyQ5bprr

name: TheAtlantic
text: "To reduce the moderator’s job to real-time fact-checking is to fundamentally misunderstand what debates are for," @jdickerson writes: https://t.co/amogjhu4aD

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We have to believe that power still lies in the people, or else we’ve already surrendered it," George Packer writes: https://t.co/cXQWUTBNk5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Reducing protections for patients with preexisting conditions isn’t a bug in Republican health-care plans—it’s a key feature, writes @RonBrownstein. https://t.co/aoQNzBA8P6

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @shirklesxp: The #GoneGirl author @TheGillianFlynn catapulted to fame with her sharp dissection of a toxic marriage. As the showrunner of #Utopia , she studies a trickier relationship: that of fact and fiction, in the age of disinformation.

My latest for @TheAtlantic: https://t.co/bn8ekNPbDY

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gillianbwhite: A new project from @TheAtlantic tells the story of the children who desegregated America's schools. Please read "The Firsts" a labor of love from @AdamHSays @beccarosen @EmilyBJan @fhill_official & @FancyBethany https://t.co/uyN0Ya8QQC https://t.co/VwYXcVgyoC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: This @ayeletw piece is honest and fascinating: https://t.co/yws4yOdYkX

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Dialing 911 was the first decision I had to make after I discovered the man by my bed—if you can describe my frantic call as a ‘decision.’” @ayeletw on attempting to do more than talk the talk: https://t.co/Jv3lOp95kc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Producers of "The Apprentice" have said that working with Donald Trump was "like making the court jester the king." By nullifying the line between fact and fiction, reality TV encourages its viewers to question everything, @megangarber writes: https://t.co/YV2SpdQgGw

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Calling what happened to Breonna Taylor a tragedy doesn’t begin to adequately address what took place that night," @JemeleHill writes: https://t.co/XIUFuPfKJE

name: TheAtlantic
text: The "Gone Girl" author Gillian Flynn doesn’t usually write ensemble thrillers on a global scale. But with her new series "Utopia," she got to explore one of her obsessions: the conspiracy theory. @shirklesxp reports: https://t.co/bNnkDLOqcW

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @mckaycoppins: When Trump learned about a megachurch pastor trying to raise $60 million to buy a private jet, he was delighted by the "scam," according to Michael Cohen, and eager to highlight that the pastor was "full of sh*t." 

"They're all hustlers," Trump said. 

https://t.co/T8UyQ5bprr

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: “That’s what Trump did to me! I knew it! I knew it! I knew I wasn’t overreacting!” the former campaign staffer Alva Johnson recalls screaming when she saw the infamous “Access Hollywood” tape. For our ongoing series, Johnson tells @ejeancarroll her story. https://t.co/ZRwg8dBWa4

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: Reducing protections for patients with preexisting conditions isn’t a bug in Republican health-care plans—it’s a key feature, writes @RonBrownstein. https://t.co/qOAaXqtK2m

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: Vital reading from @RonBrownstein ahead of tonight's debate, where Trump is sure to insist he'll protect patients with preexisting conditions: https://t.co/DahcD4QiVa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hugh Price and his family fought for him to be one of the first Black students at an all-white high school in Washington, D.C. Once he was there, he “couldn’t wait for it to be over.” One of five pieces from our special project #TheFirsts, by @AdamHSays: https://t.co/bpQRWhFf4B

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @amandamull: Cannot overstate the extent to which a functioning democracy is not one in which people's ability to vote is mediated by Uber and Nike https://t.co/LsDc5ia9Ar

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamHSays: “It felt like you were being squeezed” walking into the building, Jo Ann Allen Boyce told me. “They weren’t that close, but it felt that way, like you were being smothered by these rows of people on the side of the road.” https://t.co/YwIXYf2P4q

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @NoahBookbinder: There is simply not enough time for a meaningful Senate process, and a confirmation without such a process erodes yet one more key piece of our system of checks and balances, which is at its core what makes the American government function. In @TheAtlantic
https://t.co/4we2bzaGd0

text: RT @marinakoren: The next SpaceX crew includes three Americans, and they're all planning to vote from space in the election. Here's how that works: https://t.co/R48hYRGMIr
